definition: can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy
good (virtuous)/benevolent/well-disposed/good at sth/to improve or perfect

sentences.english: He was a silver-tongued orator who convinced many people to support him.
sentences.chinese: 他是個能言善辯的演說家，能贏得很多人的支持。

sentences.english: Many believe that a politician has to be silver-tongued.
sentences.chinese: 許多人認爲政客必須要能言善辯。

sentences.english: Obama is indeed eloquent, but diplomacy can not just empty words.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬的確能言善辯，但外交上不能光說空話。

definition: lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/nitpicking/overcritical
not recognizing one's family (idiom); self-centered and not making any allowances for the needs of one's relatives
(idiom) to freely air one's views/to be heard far and wide/to attract a lot of attention
to have a high notion of one's duty/to be highly principled
to open one's eyes wide at the sight of profit (idiom); thinking of nothing but personal gain/money-grubbing
to whisper to one another's ear
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
